articles.headline: Profits on Carbon Credits Drive Output of a Harmful Gas
articles.snippet: Manufacturers have ramped up production of a common air-conditioning coolant, counting on a windfall for destroying a byproduct under a United Nations program.
articles.abstract: Manufacturers have ramped up production of a common air-conditioning coolant, counting on a windfall for destroying a byproduct under a United Nations program.
articles.lead_paragraph: RANJIT NAGAR, India — When the United Nations wanted to help slow climate change, it established what seemed a sensible system.
articles.byline: By Elisabeth Rosenthal and Andrew W. Lehren

articles.headline: In London, Censure of an Elite Bank Draws Harrumphs
articles.snippet: British authorities are circling the wagons around Standard Chartered bank, accused in New York of money laundering.
articles.abstract: British authorities are circling the wagons around Standard Chartered bank, accused in New York of money laundering.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — In this summer of revelations about bad behavior by British financial institutions, bashing the banks has been London’s other Olympic sport.

articles.headline: An E-Mail Service With Lots of Smarts
articles.snippet: Microsoft introduces Outlook.com, a free Web-based e-mail service that improves on the tainted image of Hotmail.
articles.abstract: Microsoft introduces Outlook.com, a free Web-based e-mail service that improves on the tainted image of Hotmail.
articles.lead_paragraph: “Coming soon, from the creator of the Macarena!”... “New, from the founders of Myspace!”... “He has the same agent as Steven Seagal!”

articles.headline: Clinical Trial Is Favorable for a Prenatal Gene Test
articles.snippet: A new technique surpassed standard testing in detecting chromosomal abnormalities that can cause problems like autism or mental retardation.
articles.abstract: A new technique surpassed standard testing in detecting chromosomal abnormalities that can cause problems like autism or mental retardation.
articles.lead_paragraph: A new method of prenatal testing that can detect more genetic problems in a fetus than ever before could be headed toward wider use after encouraging results from a clinical trial, researchers said.

articles.headline: Time Wasters, Pointless but Fun
articles.snippet: There are many apps made just for people who want to fill a few minutes of downtime.
articles.abstract: There are many apps made just for people who want to fill a few minutes of downtime.
articles.lead_paragraph: Times have changed since the best way to pass an idle 10 minutes was Nokia’s famous Snake, or whatever flavor of game was built into your old, dumb cellphone. These basic games were simple entertainment and they were fun — to an extent. But with smartphones, we have thousands of app-enabled ways to pass the time waiting in line at the post office or even when struck with insomnia.

articles.headline: Google Goes Back to the Drawing Board for Nexus Q
articles.snippet: The setback from the Nexus Q reveals deeper challenges for Google as it tries to move into two new areas: hardware and social technology.
articles.abstract: The setback from the Nexus Q reveals deeper challenges for Google as it tries to move into two new areas: hardware and social technology.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — In June, Google engineers took to the stage in front of thousands of cheering software developers to introduce the Nexus Q, a black ball meant to stream video and music. It was Google’s first try at building its own hardware — in the United States, no less — and Google called it “a third wave of consumer electronics.”

articles.headline: With Rates Low, Banks Increase Mortgage Profit
articles.snippet: Bundling mortgages and selling them to investors is helping banks make big profits even as they charge lower interest rates.
articles.abstract: Bundling mortgages and selling them to investors is helping banks make big profits even as they charge lower interest rates.
articles.lead_paragraph: Interest rates on mortgages and refinancing are at record lows, giving borrowers plenty to celebrate. But the bigger winners are the banks making the loans.

articles.headline: In Laundering Case, a Lax Banking Law Obscured Money Flow
articles.snippet: In so-called U-turn transactions before 2008, global banks like Standard Chartered could provide scant information on transfers that passed in and out of the United States.
articles.abstract: In so-called U-turn transactions before 2008, global banks like Standard Chartered could provide scant information on transfers that passed in and out of the United States.
articles.lead_paragraph: The list of global banks that have been accused in recent years of laundering foreign transactions totaling billions of dollars has been growing — Credit Suisse, Lloyds, Barclays, ING, HSBC — and now Standard Chartered.
articles.byline: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Edward Wyatt

articles.headline: Plots Are Tied to Shadow War of Israel and Iran
articles.snippet: Analysts say the shadow war has more in common with the cloak-and-dagger maneuverings of the C.I.A. and the K.G.B. during the cold war than the publicity-hungry terrorism campaign of Al Qaeda.
articles.abstract: Analysts say the shadow war has more in common with the cloak-and-dagger maneuverings of the C.I.A. and the K.G.B. during the cold war than the publicity-hungry terrorism campaign of Al Qaeda.
articles.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — A magnetic bomb detonated on a diplomatic car in New Delhi. The police uncovered a cache of explosives at a golf course in the Kenyan city of Mombasa. Five Israeli tourists and a Bulgarian bus driver were killed in an attack outside the airport in the Black Sea coastal city of Burgas.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Kulish and Jodi Rudoren

articles.headline: Young in G.O.P. Erase the Lines on Social Issues
articles.snippet: Many of the youngest leaders of the Republican Party are embracing views on some social issues that are at odds with traditional conservative ideology.
articles.abstract: Many of the youngest leaders of the Republican Party are embracing views on some social issues that are at odds with traditional conservative ideology.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHARLOTTE, N.C. — Matt Hoagland, the county leader of a group of young North Carolina Republicans, is busy trying to ramp up enthusiasm for Mitt Romney at the grass-roots level. So there are a few things he avoids mentioning to prospective young voters he wants to woo, including the hot-button topics like abortion and same-sex marriage, which have dominated campaigns past.

articles.headline: $1 Million Each Year for All, as Long as Tribe’s Luck Holds
articles.snippet: A growing movement to legalize Internet gambling and give states the power to regulate and tax online gambling even on reservations is driving anxiety among the Shakopee tribe.
articles.abstract: A growing movement to legalize Internet gambling and give states the power to regulate and tax online gambling even on reservations is driving anxiety among the Shakopee tribe.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHAKOPEE MDEWAKANTON INDIAN RESERVATION, Minn. — A generation ago, the Shakopee Mdewakanton tribe lived in a motley collection of beat-up trailer homes, melting snow for bath water when wells froze over because they lacked indoor plumbing. Three-quarters of tribal members received government food supplements.

articles.headline: Fast-Paced Trial in China Murder Leaves Shadows
articles.snippet: If Chinese officials hoped the trial of Bo Xilai’s wife would show off a more transparent legal system, they are likely to be disappointed.
articles.abstract: If Chinese officials hoped the trial of Bo Xilai’s wife would show off a more transparent legal system, they are likely to be disappointed.
articles.lead_paragraph: HEFEI, China — Worried that a longtime friend and business associate might harm her only child, Gu Kailai lured him to a rented villa in southwest China, plied him with alcohol until he could take no more and then, when he began to vomit and requested a drink of water, poured a poisonous concoction into his mouth.
